Crimes.Legal_Issue: Relevance of alleged misrepresentation to Minister's decision-making
Crimes.Governing_Law: Federal Court jurisdiction over decisions obtained by fraud
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Application for judicial review with motion to compel answers and documents
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Not assessed due to failure to plead fraud
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Alleged internal corporate representations not disclosed to Minister
Crimes.Legal_Provision: Rules regarding fraud in decision-making under administrative law
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Alleged bias and procedural unfairness in favoring Sikorsky’s bid
Crimes.Evaluation_Standard: Legal relevance to the Minister's decision-making process
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to properly plead fraud as required
Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Whether information sought is legally relevant to remedy
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: Internal Sikorsky processes not submitted to Minister
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Fraud must be explicitly pleaded and proven
Crimes.Application_Factor: Request for cross-examination and document production
Crimes.Authority: Federal Court rules on judicial review scope
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Relevance of third-party internal information to administrative decision
Crimes.Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness / Correctness (implied based on fraud claim)
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Decision can be set aside if obtained by fraud or perjured evidence
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Requested information not relevant to Minister’s decision
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: Common law and Federal Courts Act principles
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of direct evidence of fraudulent intent or submission to decision-maker
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Not reached due to pleading deficiency
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Failure to meet pleading requirements for fraud
Crimes.Relevant_Law: Administrative law, judicial review standards, fraud doctrine
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Scope of discovery in judicial review
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to disclose inability to meet delivery timeline (alleged)
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Information not part of ministerial record

Crimes.Evaluation_Standard: Whether requested materials assist in granting relief
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Information not before the decision-maker is irrelevant

Crimes.Assessment_Standard: Legal relevance standard in judicial review
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: Sikorsky’s internal assessments of delivery timelines
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Fraud must be explicitly pleaded; mere misrepresentation insufficient

Crimes.Decision_Outcome: No document production or questioning ordered

Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Access to third-party records in judicial review
Crimes.Standard_of_Review: Correctness (on questions of law and fraud)
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Only information before the Minister is relevant to decision review
Crimes.Outcome_of_Review: No error found in procurement process based on record
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Internal company documents not part of administrative record
